Reviews.Title: It's perfect for our bedroom
Reviews.Author: A. Dent "Aragorn"
Reviews.Content: This was meant as a 'bedroom' TV - replacing a 15 yr. old 27-incher; the 32" size was constrained by the size of our TV cabinet - and, so far, it fully met our expectations.We made the initial decision to order this specific TV because it was on sale at the time (low price) and because I had a very positive experience with PHILIPS as a customer in the past. Since we set it up in our bedroom we liked it even more for its ease of setup and operation, high quality picture and sound (the context is the bedroom) and for its versatility/flexibility (many ports and options). The all-shiny-black, minimalist design, with all buttons invisible, hidden behind the frame is not too bad either.So, let's get into some details.SETUP AND OPERATIONSAs I noted already, it's as easy as plugging it in and hooking it up to either an antenna (coax) or cable box. The first time you turn on the TV it's going to ask about your language - English, French and Spanish are supported - look for 'channels' and then do a very clever color setup test where all you do is answer which side (right or left) you prefer for the 5 or 6 pictures displayed. You're done.Later on, you can personalize your color and sound preferences by setting up various parameters individually or by picking any of the pre-configured sets: standard, sports, movie, gaming for colors. You can set the sound parameters such as virtual surround, volume leveling, stereo/mono/SAP and you can pick form 'auto' sound or pre-set configurations such as movie, music or news.Like any modern TV, this one is upgradeable too. If you really feel the need to do so, you can pick the latest software at the Philips site, loaded on a USB drive and your TV should update itself once the USB drive is plugged into TV's USB port. NOTE: the USB port is ONLY for upgrading, it CAN'T be used to display pictures or play home videos.The small remote control is well laid out, uncluttered, with the most important functions - on/off, input source, sleep, picture format and, of course, channel and volume - accessible through dedicated buttons and the less frequently needed functions available through the 'menu' option.SPECSThis is clearly not a top of the line device and it's not meant to be so. At this size (32" to be used in the bedroom) we didn't care about 1080p so we saved by getting this good quality model at a great price. So, here's what you get:- Picture: WXGA (1366x768 at 60Hz) - typically you'll be getting 720p if watching a Blu-ray video.- Aspect ration: 16:9, also known as 'wide screen'.- Viewing angle: 170 degrees. Really, no issues viewing the picture from whatever angle.- Sound: 20W and supports virtual surround- PC input: supported via HDMI- Power: 120V, 60Hz (don't take it to Europe)CONNECTIONSQuite impressive for a TV this inexpensive. Everything that might be possibly needed from coax to HDMI (3) ports is there. No TOSLINK (optical) port, it's true but I can't see why you would need one given the TV's tiny speakers.Inputs:---------- Antenna jack (coax)- Component video and audio (on the side)- S-Video (on the side)- Composite video- HDMI ports (three ports, 2 on the back and one on the side)- USB (for software upgrades only)Outputs:------------- Analog audio- Digital audio outputWARRANTYThe limited 1 year warranty covers everything other than accident (you drop it) or abuse and either the original purchaser or someone who received the item as a gift - proof of purchase still needed. It's worth noting that you will be responsible for shipping and shipping costs if there is a need to have your TV fixed so make sure that you save your receipt and the original box.Since I mentioned on the first paragraph that I picked a PHILIPS because of a prior good customer experience, maybe it's worth sharing it because not all companies treat their customers with respect AFTER the sale. A couple of years ago my old PHILIPS monitor decided to stop working. It was covered by a 2-year warranty and 'I thought' it was still under warranty but I could not find the proof of purchase. To make it short, the Philips person established the date the monitor was manufactured from the serial number and, even if it was a little over '2 years ago' agreed to have my monitor repaired under warranty even though I could not produce a receipt. They added '3 months' to the manufacture date because they estimated it would take that long for a unit to be sold. I don't believe that many companies would do this much for their FORMER customers.MY RATINGIt should be clear by now that it's a 5-star and it's so because it does everything a bedroom TV is expected to do: it fits inside the TV cabinet, it was inexpensive, it's easy to operate and, so far, it has delivered good-quality pictures reliably.-->> Brush your teeth, it's the law! <<

Reviews.Title: Excellent value. Beautiful picture, sound is very good.
Reviews.Author: GirlX ""Addicted to Amazon""
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews and visited the stores to look at several TVs before reaching a decision. It came down to this one and a couple other brands, but the deciding factor came from past experience.  I purchased a refurbished Philips TV in the past that was still in perfect condition and 5 years later, I've never had any issues with it. When I called tech support for an issue I didn't think would be easily fixed, they gave me a suggestion that worked in 10 minutes AND they called back the next day to make sure I was satisfied.I ordered this TV from Amazon on a Wednesday. I paid no tax and selected free super saver shipping... it arrived on Friday. It's super lightweight, I was able to pick it up without a problem at all.  Assembly was very easy, you will just need a cross head screwdriver to attach the stand. It took 5 minutes to put together.  The remote is very lightweight and came with batteries as well.I found the 3 HDMI ports to be very convenient, as I have several things to attach.  In fact, I plugged an HDMI cable into my laptop and watched streaming videos on the TV screen.The setup screen will appear when it's first plugged in, so colors and volume settings can be selected. The picture was crystal clear even before I had the HDTV cable box installed. The screen is bright and vibrant and in a 15x15 room, the sound is PLENTY loud. I have it at 20 right now and that's very good. I'm not sure how far it goes, but I got it up to 30 and felt I was probably blasting out my neighbors in the apartment upstairs so I didn't go further.There are no dark shadows, no matter what angle you're viewing.  Even when standing next to it and viewing it from the side, the picture is perfect.  The way my living room is set up, I have the TV across from a large patio door that takes up nearly the whole wall and a lot of light shines in. The glare is very minimal and I haven't seen a need to close the blinds to see the picture yet.The frame around it is glossy and prone to fingerprinting, but that's really my only complaint! I am in love with this TV and I'm thrilled with my purchase, especially for the price. I would definitely recommend this TV and the Philips brand to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Patrick1211
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a decent, low priced LCD TV than this is the TV for you. The quality surpasses the suggested retail price, and fulfilled all the requirements I was looking for in a brand new LCD TV. I was very pleased with my purchase, but that doesn't mean this particular TV was without faults.I bought this TV from a retailer, not from Amazon, so I can't speak to the shipping or quality from any Amazon seller. However, I can speak on how this TV measures up. The selling point of this TV was the price and the lack of negative reviews on this site. The main thing I was looking for in a new LCD TV was the picture, and once connected to a HD source complete with an HDMI cord, I was very pleased with the results. The visual experience of this TV exceeded my expectations of a low cost 720p resolution TV. With this TV you will experience as much HD quality that a 720p TV can give.  Being a 32 inch screen this TV will give ample viewing for a small to medium size room. I have seen no problems watching this TV at any reasonable angle. The only problem I have experienced from the visual aspect of this TV is that it takes a second or two to switch from one HD channel to the next (the screen will go black for said duration). Other than the short duration it takes to switch from one HD channel to the next, I have absolutely no complaints with the visual experience from this TV.While the sound from a TV speakers is not the main concern I have when buying a new TV some may hold this in high regard. The quality of the speakers of this TV are not the main selling point of this TV. The speakers are not terrible, but they are also not all that amazing. When played at higher level of sound the built in speakers will rattle a bit. It seems to only happen at certain pitches, but while watching ESPN some of the voices made a certain annoying buzz on the built in speakers. I did not feel this was a deal breaker, but some more picky individuals may be more concerned. The only thing I can compare this sound with is when sub-woofers in a car make the car rattle (hard for me to explain this, I hope this makes sense). This rattling doesn't happen often, but when it does it is noticeable. If this bothers you, I would suggest getting external speakers. The speakers of this TV is indicative of the price, as in it's not top of the line.All in all, I am pleased with the TV. It has lived up to and exceeded the pricing of other TV like it, but it is not without its faults. If you are looking for a cheaper TV that provides a superior visual experience then this TV is one to consider. The only downsides are the delays when changing from one HD channel to the next, and the sub par built in speakers. I have had this TV for one month and I am very pleased with its performance given its price.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, nice price
Reviews.Author: John Strange
Reviews.Content: This TV is being used mainly by my children to watch DVDs and a bit of TV. It's not the full 1080p HD picture, but picture and sound quality are just fine and the remote control is refreshingly uncluttered. There are ample inputs for all the devices I'm ever likely to plug into it. About the only thing I could use which isn't there is a headphone jack.Recommended.

Reviews.Title: TWICE AS BIG AND THE COLOR IS GREAT
Reviews.Author: Mark K. McDaniel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV because I made a promise to myself if I complete a particular goal in my life this will be my reward! I am so glad I completed the goal! I bought the TV for my bedroom. I originally had a 19" CRT style TV mounted up on a shelf in the corner of my room. It worked good there since 1994.I finally got the TV mounted up on the wall. It would not fit on the shelf where the original TV was mounted. The color on this set just "jumps" out at you. And I have to tell you I am running this TV on rabbit ear style antenna. There was no need for the converter box (that I had with the other TV). plugged it right in and the TV searched for all of the available stations. I picked the ones I wanted and omitted the ones I did not want to view.You also have to understand the the streaming capabilities. Every signal that comes into your home comes in at 480p. So unless you are doing a lot of gaming on your TV you do not need anything higher than a 720p. It's the way the different manufactures are ripping you off by selling capabilities that you will never need.The cost was a good thing too. I payed $349.00 (out the door price) and that was delivered to my front door. A week later I saw the same TV at the Target Store for the sale price of $369.00 plus tax. I can't complain it's TWICE AS BIG AND THE COLOR IS GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Phillips LCD they rock.
Reviews.Author: Vench "Iceman"
Reviews.Content: This is my third phillips lcd and ALL are working fine.  This replaced my 20" from a few years ago in a bedroom.  As others have said the 720P is awesome for this tv, with Dish 1080I coming in it looks "crystal" clear.  You will not be diappointed by this tv in any way.  Good number of hook-ups, easy, easy set-up and the remote is actually realy good.  Lots of options but realy the basic set up walk thru leaves you with a excellent picture.  I have a 47, 32 and 20 inch Phillips going and I have never looked back on my decision.I also purchased the cheap $ 2.50 HDMI cable sold by the amazon and wish I never spent the 29 for the larger tv.  thanks Amazon for great price, product and delivery.Buy a Phillips and Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: Great for watching Television, but maybe not so much for other things
Reviews.Author: Nicholas A. Haury
Reviews.Content: When I started looking for a flatscreen TV to replace my old CTR there were a few things that I had in mind. Firstly, I wanted to be able to use the television as a secodary/primary monitor for my laptop. Secondly I wanted to be able to play xbox games in wonderful HD. Watching television was actually more of a side note in my case. Unfortunately, both of my goals were problematic. In regards to using the television as a second monitor, there is no VGA input. The options are either s-video or HDMI. I wasn't aware that many computers have HDMI outputs like the description seems to indicate, and the s-video option has a much too low resolution to be used practically. As for playing xbox games, the television itself has a noticeable display lag. Many televisions come with an option that can eliminate this by turning the tv to "game mode" or reducing the extra effects which cause the lag. Unfortunately this tv has neither of those options. In the end, the television basically was not the right one for what I was trying to do, and if there are other's trying to do the same thing then you should take notice. I can't really comment on how well it works for actually watching television, but after flipping through a few channels and whatnot it seems to be excellent in that respect. I'm going to try and return the tv and see what happens, and try to do a little more research next time I go TV shopping.*updateI was able to return the tv and Amazon gave me my full money's worth back (well, minus 6 bucks for having UPS come and pick it up for me). As per the usual, Amazon has excellent customer service, and I plan on continuing to shop here well in to the future.

Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: Computer Techie "Marty M"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to replace my old 32" with a newer model. I like this one bscause it is easy to set up and the picture quality is above average. The features of multiple HDMI ports and a USB port are super. Being able to update the firmware is a plus. The only con I have is the the side inputs just happen to be on the right (as you look at it) and my other equipment is shelved to the left side. Just means I have to use longer cables. All in all this TV gets 4.5 stars from me!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tv. Easy set up
Reviews.Author: Ishcakes
Reviews.Content: This TV is amazing. I am using it as a tv in my bedroom coming from a 19inch. So I am definitely amazed with this tv. I opened up the box, plugged it in, went right through the set up. The set up takes 10-15 mins or so depending on how long the channel search is going to take. After that it was ready to go. I hooked my xbox up to it to try it out and the picture is so clear. I am also impressed with the sound. It sounds really good and I don't have to turn the TV up too much to hear it. Its a very nice tv and worth the money. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: IT SAVED CHRISTMAS
Reviews.Author: Roberto Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Picked this TV after previous purchase of an LG went south.The picture is amazing and the walk thru setup was very easy. The sound is very clear even on high with little feedback.Didn't even have to re-program the cable remote because old CRT TV was also Philips and it turn on TV/channels/sound and everything. Even the Radio Shack remote which is 7 years old and geared for the Old TV worked, including the switching of inputs. Talk about being consistent across product lines! Saved me from having to dig up instructions.Now I just have listen to kids argue about who gets to watch what. Family very Happy.

Reviews.Title: Does not turn on, power board replaced twice
Reviews.Author: Preciado
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV and used it for about 100 hours the first year, then it wouldn't turn on as expected, I had to press the power button over 10 times to get it on, took it to a repair shop and got charged $150 to replace the power main board, had it on for about 20 hours and the same thing happened now the repair shop wants to charge me another $150 to replace the same thing.I see other customers writing about the same problem, this must be a manufacturing flaw. WILL NOT BUY PHILLIPS PRODUCTS AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: On/Off malfunction
Reviews.Author: Hilltop Farm
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV because I have had good luck with my older Philips TV and have loved this one, but all of the sudden it turned itself off and now when I turn it on it just shuts itself off in a few seconds. It is just out of warranty (I purchased an extended warranty). I paid $349. for the TV. I contacted an authorized Philips service center and was told it would cost $70. to $90. to look at the TV with repair costs added so I decided to buy a new TV (not Philips).

Reviews.Title: stay away from this tv
Reviews.Author: s.w.
Reviews.Content: I'll try to make a long  story short.  I bought this tv in March of 2011. It did not have the picture quality I hoped for but I could live with it. In January of 2012 it got so I would have to turn it on about 15 time before it would stay on.  I called customer support at Phillips and had to email them a copy of the receipt because they said it was not in warranty. After a week they decided it was warranty and sent me another tv (wich took over 2weeks). Customer service was very nice and easy to deal with. However, they sent me a refurbished tv that was all scratched up and had a loud buzz to it. So they told me they were going to send out another tv (a new one this time). It is now March 24 and still no tv. I keep calling them and all they will tell me is that my case has been sent to someone at there corp. and I will have to wait until they contact me, Ill update if and when this gets resolved. Do yourself a favor and stay away from this tv and Phillips.

Reviews.Title: Good value but not a great TV
Reviews.Author: Mike D "Mike"
Reviews.Content: This TV is good for the money but it struggles with dark contrast and fast action (sports)as I'm sure all LCDs in this price range would.  No regrets, I knew I wasn't paying for top quality and this TV serves it's purpose as a second TV.Set up is easy and on screen controls are equally user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Philips 32-Inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Anne Harman
Reviews.Content: I have never purchased a TV from Amazon before, but I would not hesitate to do it again.  The TV arrived on time, was easy to remove from the shipping box, and was easy to set up and connect to cable TV.  The sound is great, the picture is clear, and the color is very good.  I am not a person who watches a lot of TV, but I do enjoy watching certain special programs.  This particular TV was obtained at a very reasonable price from Amazon and I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Monte David Shuck
Reviews.Content: Easy and quick to set up.  Like the on-screen side-by-side image choices for brightness, sharpness, etc.  Good picture quality.  Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Holly Amlin
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a smaller hdtv, primarily to be used in a bedroom. Target had a sale on a Sylvania 32" LCD HDTV for $299, but they were sold out. They were offering a "In Place Of" Sale on this Philips for $274 (on sale for $369). It was quite a catch, so I took advantage. Despite the 720p, the quality is equal to the 1080p. Great hdtv!

Reviews.Title: Disapointed
Reviews.Author: MAC
Reviews.Content: Good design and ease of you, but......Horrid artifacting and blur on fast moving things like sports and movies.  Very hard to get around that. Usually love Philips products but this falls very short of my expectations.

Reviews.Title: awesome deal
Reviews.Author: Todd dunihue
Reviews.Content: I got the T.V. for my daughters room + the wall mount. It was perfect. worked great and the kids can't reach it.

Reviews.Title: Began to have trouble AFTER warranty expired
Reviews.Author: Liatris
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV in Feb 2011, and in Jun 2012 it began having difficulties turning on.  When we turn it on it shuts off instantly, and we have to start it about 20 times before it finally stays on.  I called Philips and followed tech support's instructions to download a software update and install it on the TV.  It didn't fix the problem, and when I called Philips back, because the TV was over 1 year old their advice was to take it to a repair shop.  Needless to say we are very disappointed in this TV, we expected it to last a bit longer for the $300 price tag.  Will NOT be buying any Philips products again.

Reviews.Title: Bad Sound
Reviews.Author: hilsbils
Reviews.Content: The sound just fades in and out.  The picture will freeze for a split second and you might loose a word or two from the broadcaster or the actor.  It is very annoying. This is our main tv but I am going to have to replace it.  I have had this TV for a little over a year and it cannot be returned.  I think I will buy a tv from Costco at least they give you a 2 year guarantee.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Love this TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: I. Becker
Reviews.Content: I finally upgraded my Panasonic combo TV/VCR for this LCD HDTV. I read many reviews before I finally decided on this television. I also went to a local store to look at the screens and compare their picture quality. The picture was crisp and of high quality compared to the others and the price was much better as well. I didn't get the cheapest in price, but the highest level of picture quality with a price that was more in the median level. Totally worth every penny. The sound is amazing as well. I have this tv set up in my bedroom and I think it's the perfect size. If you plan to hook this up to your blu-ray DVD player or HD ready cable box, then you will need to have the HD cable, which is an added cost. I love that you can personalize the sound and picture to what you like. It also has game, movie, and other settings so that you get the perfect picture for what you are watching. I can't say enough about this tv. I have had Panasonic, Samsung, and a Plasma Sylvania, and this is my favorite! Great quality. And many might worry that it's only a 720 instead of a 1080, but for this size it doesn't really matter. It matters when you have a larger tv. Very happy with my purchase! It was the perfect birthday gift from my husband. A gift that keeps on giving! :)

Reviews.Title: Really like this Television
Reviews.Author: A. J. Flowers
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, we bought this model for an elderly couple we love for a gift.  They didn't want a large T.V. in their living room and this one was perfect.  They really enjoy it. We were pleasantly surprised by the ease of set-up and the easy to use interface.The colors are bright and the screen is crisp even though they are watching SD most of the time, they are able to get many HD channels. (they have basic cable).We liked it so much, we just bought one for a guest bedroom. Got ours at Sams with a 90 day return.  Got some great prices. (under $300 delivered.Hard to believe that we paid almost $700 for a 32 inch 720p Samsung 3 years ago and that was a good price at the time it was even more at BB. This Philips is a great value, so why pay the extra money? Wow have the prices gone down so shop around.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Porter
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the guest room, but we moved our Sony out of the way in our bedroom to check out the Phillips.  Other than being smaller, it put the Sony to shame.  The setup was so simple , I thought is that all there is?  The picture is clearer, brighter and deeper almost than our brand new 46" Samsung in the family room  The digital tuner meant no need for the cable box.  I will not be hooking up any thing else to it as the sound is adequate for the room and I don't want visitors to move in (ha ha).  Overall, it's a great tv for the expense.

Reviews.Title: Perfect size and Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Beamer
Reviews.Content: Recently bought this for my son's Birthday.  It was easy to set up and the Qaulity of the picture was great.  Perfect size for his apartment.

Reviews.Title: office tv
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Fronek
Reviews.Content: set up was a breeze hooked up the cable for the satellite dish and we were good to go ran the auto channel add and it added  about 4 regular channels that come in clear this tv i great for a offic or a bedroom great picture and has very good sound all parts needed for assembly were in the box and was easy to put the base together would recommend this tv,i have the 48" one made by the same manufacter and there both great tv,s shipping was great and was very quick and no damage to anything not even the outside of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great buy/ Great tv!!
Reviews.Author: Duane Gittens
Reviews.Content: I was blasted away by the price, the speed in which it was delivered (2 days!)and the functions of this set! I am thoroughly pleased with my new lcd/hdtv. I highly recommend this set and the vendor I purchased it from. Exactly as advertised!!Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: butterfly p
Reviews.Content: Well i bought the tv for my grandmother and so it was very easy to set up and install. The picture could be better in my opionion but then again that is on just the basic channels not the hd channels. I have no complaints so far everything is working properly, but if that changes i will be back.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: Edward Anthony Espinoza
Reviews.Content: So I moved into a new apartment and was looking for a TV for the living room. I wanted something slim , black , and good qualtiy. I browsed Amazon for about a week and found this TV. It was a great price and was delivered in 2 days. It has great picture and sound.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Phillips Product; Fantastic company!!!
Reviews.Author: Michael R Williamson
Reviews.Content: Why would you put a review for a refurbished TV on the page where they are selling the TV in brand-new condition?  Referring to the review by the purchaser of the refurbished TV.  Come on, buy it new, get a warranty.  If you're having problems with a refurbished item, you shouldn't have cut corners and tried to save $20.00.  Spend the little extra money to do things the right way the first time, within your budget.  If you can't afford it, don't take the refurb shortcut.Phillips has been wonderful to me, I purchased a TV smaller than this one (19"), and had some minor problems.  Phillips replaced the old one with a new one that was of higher pixel count and a much nicer tv than I originally bought.  Incredible company, and I have heard the same regarding Samsung.  I'm going to buy this TV or one similar soon for another room in my home.  I look forward to the Phillips product in my home.

Reviews.Title: Awful white spots!!!
Reviews.Author: turbomatic
Reviews.Content: I bought and returned two of these from a major big box store. Both had huge white spots/hazing around the bottom frame of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Remote Problem for Directv Subscribers
Reviews.Author: Sailor "www.ShoeboxProject.org"
Reviews.Content: I would have given t his a 5 star rating, but as a Directv subscriber I am forced to use 2 different remotes at the same time.  I must use the Philips remote, a cheap little black plastic device impossible to use without light & reading glasses, to turn on & off, & for volume control.  Directv claims it is Philips fault for not supplying remote control codes for switching these functions to their single remote control, while Philips claims they have supplied Directv with the infared signals their engineers need to generate codes.  A second call to Directv got me to a tech who tried to be helpful, but none of the codes he had worked.  It is extremely annoying to have to use 2 different remotes, especially since the Philips remote is terribly susceptible to kitty paws, which continually muck with the settings.  At this point is is unclear whether the fault lies with Philips or Directv, but the result is that I find myself constantly reaching for a different remote, especially when a loud commercial intrudes, & my settings are continually getting jammed by wandering cats, who are just trying to get comfy beside me.  This is not a problem unique to Philips, as my primary tv also requires 2 remotes, & although a different brand, Directv has yet to be able to give me a code that works to convert me to a one-handed remote user.

Reviews.Title: On/Off malfunction
Reviews.Author: Doctor
Reviews.Content: This product performs in about the 7 out of 10 range. Occasionally the screen will flicker between screens, i.e. changing channels, going from the menu to a channel, switching from on demand back to real time tv etc. It is also very slow to turn on and will sometimes not turn on at all. It will randomly not respond to the universal remote, the remote that came with the tv, nor the power button on the tv! In these cases I have had to unplug the tv, wait for a few seconds, and then try again. I don't know why this would work, but so far that has been the solution. I purchased a refurbished tv, so this may be the cause of its problems and not the brand.
